segment.source: Improving Security During App-V Sequencing
segment.target: Improving Security During App-V Sequencing

segment.source: Improving Security During App-V Sequencing
segment.target: Improving Security During App-V Sequencing

segment.source: Improving Security During App-V Sequencing
segment.target: Improving Security During App-V Sequencing

segment.source: Packaging applications for sequencing is the largest ongoing task in an App-V infrastructure.
segment.target: Packaging applications for sequencing is the largest ongoing task in an App-V infrastructure.

segment.source: Because this task is ongoing, you should carefully consider creating policies and procedures to follow when sequencing applications.
segment.target: Because this task is ongoing, you should carefully consider creating policies and procedures to follow when sequencing applications.

segment.source: In App-V 4.5, during sequencing, you can capture Access Control Lists (ACLs) on the file assets of the virtualized application.
segment.target: In App-V 4.5, during sequencing, you can capture Access Control Lists (ACLs) on the file assets of the virtualized application.

segment.source: Virus Scanning on the Sequencer
segment.target: Virus Scanning on the Sequencer

segment.source: It is a best practice to install the scanning software on the sequencing computer and then scan the computer for viruses and malware.
segment.target: It is a best practice to install the scanning software on the sequencing computer and then scan the computer for viruses and malware.

segment.source: After the sequencing computer is scanned and free of any viruses or malware, disable the scanning software, including all antivirus and malware detection software, on the sequencing computer before sequencing any applications.
segment.target: After the sequencing computer is scanned and free of any viruses or malware, disable the scanning software, including all antivirus and malware detection software, on the sequencing computer before sequencing any applications.

segment.source: This speeds the sequencing process and prevents the scanning software components from being detected during sequencing and included in the virtual application package.
segment.target: This speeds the sequencing process and prevents the scanning software components from being detected during sequencing and included in the virtual application package.

segment.source: Capturing ACLs on Files (NTFS)
segment.target: Capturing ACLs on Files (NTFS)

segment.source: The Sequencer captures NTFS permissions (the ACLs) for the files that are monitored during the sequencing installation phase.
segment.target: The Sequencer captures NTFS permissions (the ACLs) for the files that are monitored during the sequencing installation phase.

segment.source: (Before the release of App-V 4.5, ACLs were not captured as part of the sequencing process.) This new feature enables certain applications to run for users with a low level of permission that would normally require Administrative privileges.
segment.target: (Before the release of App-V 4.5, ACLs were not captured as part of the sequencing process.) This new feature enables certain applications to run for users with a low level of permission that would normally require Administrative privileges.

segment.source: This feature also enables the sequencing engineer to capture the security settings identified by the vendor.
segment.target: This feature also enables the sequencing engineer to capture the security settings identified by the vendor.

segment.source: Failing to apply the settings recommended by the vendor could leave the application open to attack or misuse by users.
segment.target: Failing to apply the settings recommended by the vendor could leave the application open to attack or misuse by users.

segment.source: For information about whether or not you should deploy an application with open ACLs, refer to your application support group or the software vendor.
segment.target: For information about whether or not you should deploy an application with open ACLs, refer to your application support group or the software vendor.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Although the sequencer captures the NTFS ACLs while monitoring the installation phase of sequencing, it does not capture the ACLs for the registry.
segment.target: Although the sequencer captures the NTFS ACLs while monitoring the installation phase of sequencing, it does not capture the ACLs for the registry.

segment.source: Users have full access to all registry keys for virtual applications except for services.
segment.target: Users have full access to all registry keys for virtual applications except for services.

segment.source: However, if a user modifies the registry of a virtual application, that change is stored in a specific location () and won’t affect other users.
segment.target: However, if a user modifies the registry of a virtual application, that change is stored in a specific location () and won’t affect other users.

segment.source: During the installation phase, a sequencing engineer can modify the default permissions of the files if necessary.
segment.target: During the installation phase, a sequencing engineer can modify the default permissions of the files if necessary.

segment.source: After the sequencing process is complete, but before saving the package, the sequencing engineer can then choose to enforce security descriptors that were captured during the installation phase.
segment.target: After the sequencing process is complete, but before saving the package, the sequencing engineer can then choose to enforce security descriptors that were captured during the installation phase.

segment.source: It is a best practice to enforce security descriptors if no other solution allows the application to run properly once virtualized.
segment.target: It is a best practice to enforce security descriptors if no other solution allows the application to run properly once virtualized.
